Human aging is a complex biological process that affects the body's ability to function properly. As we age, our cells undergo changes that can lead to a decline in physical and mental abilities. Telomeres, the protective caps on chromosomes, shorten with each cell division, eventually leading to cell death. Mitochondria, the energy-producing structures within cells, also decline in efficiency, contributing to age-related diseases. Furthermore, the accumulation of oxidative stress and genetic mutations can cause cellular damage, accelerating the aging process. These changes can lead to age-related diseases such as cancer, Alzheimer's, and osteoporosis. Effective management of aging requires a holistic approach. - 2023
